uk.co.javahelp.maven.plugin.fitnesse.mojo
Class WikiMojo

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.maven.plugin.AbstractMojo
      uk.co.javahelp.maven.plugin.fitnesse.mojo.AbstractFitNesseMojo
          uk.co.javahelp.maven.plugin.fitnesse.mojo.WikiMojo
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContextEnabled, Mojo
public class WikiMojo
extends AbstractFitNesseMojo

Goal that launches FitNesse as a wiki server. Useful for manually running / developing / debugging FitNesse tests. Once launched, just visit http://localhost:<port>/<suite>. Use the 'shutdown' goal (from a different command line), or Ctrl+C to shutdown, or send GET to http://localhost:<port>/?responder=shutdown.

Is defined by the goal name:
wiki
Requires the dependencies in this specified scope:
test
Is bound to the specified phase of the standard build lifecycle:
integration-test

Constructor Detail

WikiMojo

public WikiMojo()
Method Detail

executeInternal

protected final void executeInternal(Launch... launches)
                              throws MojoExecutionException,
                                     MojoFailureException
Unfortunately, the FitNesse API does not expose a way to stop the wiki server programmatically, except via a sending "/?responder=shutdown" via HTTP, which is what the Shutdown object does. The object / method we need access to is FitNesse.stop(). This could easily have been returned from our public call to FitNesseMain

We need to discover the FitNesse thread running (which is not exposed either). This is not a daemon thread, but we need to join() it all the same, as Maven calls System.exit() once it's business is done.

Specified by:
executeInternal in class AbstractFitNesseMojo
Throws:
MojoExecutionException
MojoFailureException
